issues.message: Spec is not mocking trpc for the exact import path(s) used by the page.

suggestions.message: At the top of specs/tracker.spec.tsx, add a jest.mock for '@careeros/trpc'.
suggestions.code: jest.mock('@careeros/trpc', () => { const trpc = { tracker: { getApplications: { useQuery: () => ({ data: [] }) }, createApplication: { useMutation: () => ({ mutate: jest.fn() }) }, updateApplication: { useMutation: () => ({ mutate: jest.fn() }) }, deleteApplication: { useMutation: () => ({ mutate: jest.fn() }) } } }; return { __esModule: true, trpc, default: { trpc } }; }, );

suggestions.message: @careeros/trpc does not resolve from the web project root. If your page imports this path, either add a workspace alias or mock it virtually in Jest.
suggestions.exampleVirtualMock: jest.mock('@careeros/trpc', () => ({ __esModule: true, trpc: { tracker: {/* ... */} }, default: { trpc: { /* ... */ } } }), { virtual: true });
